author: Slidebean
description:
HP is quietly cutting 10% of its workforce and AI is the reason.

HP just announced that up to 10% of its global workforce will be gone by 2028.
Not because of a crisis but because of a long term plan to save $1B through “AI efficiencies.”

A new MIT study says AI can already replace 12% of U.S. jobs for less than a human salary.
Notice how close that number is to HP’s target.

This isn’t a sudden AI apocalypse.
It’s a slow, deliberate, multi year corporate strategy that’s already underway.

.

👉 Visit our YouTube channel for more content.
title: HP’s long term plan reveals what AI job loss really looks like
